name: Fifteen Waste
desc: Perfectly generic, these shoes are popular among artists. These shoes are constantly recycled; when traded back to Terracycle for supplies, they are repurposed into new pairs and redistributed to their employees. As such, working at Terracycle is quite dangerous; shoes are in high demand.

name: Air Jordan CCXIV
desc: These shoes have spiked toes and muscle-activated thrusters on the heels. Due to their capability for assisting in fast travel in addition to combat, they are known as 'Heelys' in some circles.

name: Snow Star
desc: Mountain climbing shoes with the ability to expand and become snow shoes. Being low quality, they often get stuck in one form or the other, making them difficult to use.

name: Ultraboost 112
desc: The third in Adidas' line of travel shoes, the Ultraboost pair allows nearly 360° movement in the air. As they are spike-tipped, they're often called 'Luxury Heelys,' in reference to the cheaper brand.

name: Blazer Mid 7077
desc: Flamethrower shoes. Though they are strong in combat, their lack of travel functionality and tendancy to sweep the user off their feat bring them down somewhat.

name: New Challenger
desc: The ultimate in combat shoes. Spiked tips, full force-field, 360° muscle-activated thrusters, front-facing blasters; there is a reason they're so pricey.

name: Alphabounce++++
desc: High jump shoes, to the extreme. Capable of launching a full-size person to 30 feet, but with no method of getting down, these shoes are used as a method of execution; you either take a step, launching yourself to your death, or you starve.

name: Alphabounce+++++
desc: High jump shoes with light thrusters. Useful for not perishing from the 30 foot fall.

name: Power Sandals
desc: These shoes were designed to launch explosives, but the launchers don't work.

name: Safety Shoe 2
desc: These shoes are for protecting your feet from danger. As such, they are airtight; and, by extension, they do not come off.

name: Air Max 2700
desc: Fast-Travel boots, mostly used by mail carriers. Can get you from one side of the world to the other in just over 10 hours, but with no combat capabilities, you cannot take breaks in the middle; you will end up raided.

name: React Vision 20
desc: These shoes have infrared scanners on them, as well as standard combat capabilities. They connect to a visor, highlighting any living beings nearby.

name: Blazer Mid 577
desc: an earlier version of the Flamethrower shoes. These ones did not have capabilities for disipating heat.

name: HSS
desc: Heat Seeking Shoes. When you kick, small thrusters on the shoes make sure your kick hits. Surprisingly high quality.

name: Killshot 7023
desc: On hit, these shoes completely vaporize a target.

name: Dunk High
desc: These shoes are programmed to perform a high jump into a diving kick. It happens every time you take a step.

name: React Element 92
desc: Nuclear shoes. They are very effective.

name: Harden Vol. 256
desc: Shoes that can instantly put up a full-body forcefield on command. Simple, effective, and can mean the difference between life and death in a fight. Could theoretically protect from a nuclear blast.

name: Energyfalcon 15
desc: Shoes that can control a drone. Novel concept that fell off.

name: Continental 300
desc: Using a thin layer of air, these shoes can allow you to skate across water. They also can go very fast; using their engines, they can get up to around 300mph going between continents.

name: Rockers
desc: These shoes are made entirely of rocks, in an attempt to become the new standard. They are unbelievably painful to wear, due to the fact that they have sharp rocks in the soles.
